description:
Bissell Centre sends each daily worker in our Casual Labour Program out with a bagged lunch. This gift will provide ten people with the nutrition to keep them working hard all day.

name: Laundry Services [DI2]
description:
When you live on the street you have very little clothing options, and your clothes tend to get dirty very quickly from sleeping on the ground and walking everywhere you go. 

This can be a challenge when you are going for job interviews and talking to landlords about renting an apartment. 

Give someone access to our laundry facilities for one month to help them find employment and housing. 

                   _______________________

name: One Pre-employment Program Session [EM4]
description:
Women’s Pre-Employment Program 
Women who are ready to re-enter the workforce need assistance with their resume, interviewing skills, and job searches. That’s what they receive when entering this ten session program at Bissell Centre. 

Strengthening Our Spirits 
This program uses traditional Aboriginal teachings, talking circles, employment readiness workshops, and basic computer skills to prepare adult students for joining or rejoining the work force. 

Moving Up
This program provides our Drop-In participants with training workshops, safety courses, and help to identify and overcome personal barriers.  Participants are given the tools to find full-time employment.

This gift allows us to provide a person one session in any of these programs. 

                   _______________________

Please indicate, using the below option field, if you'd like a blank seasonal card sent to you, or another recipient.  Please provide the name and mailing address of the recipient in the Notes field of PayPal during the checkout process.

options.name: No thanks! I don't need a card
Yes, I would like a card

name: Nurture Our Little Ones [CS1]
description:
Provide a day of free care, which includes a nutritious breakfast, lunch and snack, in our Childcare Centre.  As a fully accredited daycare program, our activities provide children the opportunity to learn and grow through play.  

This program is important for parents as it enables them to access other Bissell Centre programs, go to appointments, look for a job or housing, or go to school. 

                   _______________________

Yes, I would like a card

name: Community Closet [CC2]
description:
Our Community Closet provides individuals with two shirts, two pairs of pants, two pairs of socks, two pieces of underwear, a pair of footwear, a coat, a pair of winter mittens, a toque, and a backpack or bag (all items are new or gently used donations).

Clients can "shop" our Community Closet once per season (every 3 months).  Approximately 4,500 vouchers are redeemed each year. 

This gift helps support the operations of this program. 

                   _______________________

name: Where Most Needed [RD2]
description:
Your gift will go towards the program with the highest need for funding at the time of donating. 

We have programs that help families with free temporary childcare, provide employment opportunities for people, assist individuals with Fetal Alcohol Spectrum of Services, house chronically homeless people, support victims of crime, give help to those suffering from Mental Health issues, and much more!

name: Parenting Programs for Impoverished Parents [FS7]
description:
Our Family Support Services program provides information and resources to families working to raise healthy, happy children. 

Many families we serve are coping with issues associated with poverty, isolation and lack of extended family or other supports. Therefore we offer parenting classes to help parents deal with some of these issues and to learn parenting skills.

name: Women's Lunch Program [FD1]
description:
Have you ever fed your family before yourself to make sure they are taken care of? Or seen your mother or grandmother act selflessly in the same way? 

Women clients at Bissell Centre are regularly taking care of their children or significant others first, this is their chance to make sure they get a hot, nutritious meal, twice a week. 

This gift will help feed approximately 10 deserving women a hot meal.

name: Send a Family to Camp for a Night [MB2]
description:
Bissell Centre's Moonlight Bay Centre on Lake Wabamun is a beautiful setting for summer camps for adults and families living in poverty. 

Sending a child and their parent(s) to camp, to getaway from the inner city for a night, offer an experience that our participants can't get anywhere else. 

Help take a families mind off of hunger, poverty, and homelessness!

name: Employment Program Materials [EM5]
description:
Provide the program materials to run one pre-employment program and help people find full-time jobs to create sustainable lives for themselves and their families. 

Our 3 pre-employment programs include:

Women’s Pre-Employment Program 
Women who are ready to re-enter the workforce need assistance with    their resume, interviewing skills, and job searches. That’s what they receive when entering this ten session program at Bissell Centre. 

Strengthening Our Spirits 
This program uses traditional Aboriginal teachings, talking circles, employment readiness workshops, and basic computer skills to prepare adult students for joining or rejoining the work force. 

Moving Up
This program provides our Drop-In participants with training workshops, safety courses, and help to identify and overcome personal barriers.  Participants are given the tools to find full-time employment.

                   _______________________

Yes, I would like a card

description:
Give a baby a healthy start.  Bissell’s Baby Starter Kits include everything a new family needs:  a baby bathtub, soothers, formula, outfits, face cloths, receiving blanket, bottles, hygiene products, wet wipes, and diapers.

name: Drop-In Centre [DI3]
description:
The Robert Tegler Friendship Room (Adult Drop-In) is a space for men and women to get their basic daily needs met, get in from the cold or the heat, and make life-long relationships with staff and other community members. On average 400 people attend the Drop-in daily and have direct access to many programs, services, and staff to help lift them out of poverty. Our doors are open seven days per week, we serve more than 300 meals daily, and volunteer nurses come in to do testing and immunizations.

Your gift will help us feed 100 people. 

  _______________________

name: A 4 Night Stay at Moonlight Bay [MB1]
description:
Bissell Centre's Moonlight Bay Centre (MBC) on Lake Wabamun is a chance for someone living in poverty to get out of the city, away from the fear and anxiety of homelessness, poverty and hunger. 

Help provide a little bit of reprieve to someone who doesn't have the means to travel on their own. Send them to MBC for four relaxing and fun days and nights.

description:

Women’s Pre-Employment Program 

Women who are ready to re-enter the workforce need assistance with their resume, interviewing skills, and job searches. That’s what they receive when entering this ten session program at Bissell Centre. 

Strengthening Our Spirits 

This program uses traditional Aboriginal teachings, talking circles, employment readiness workshops, and basic computer skills to prepare adult students for joining or rejoining the work force. 

Moving Up

This program provides our Drop-In participants with training workshops, safety courses, and help to identify and overcome personal barriers.  Participants are given the tools to find full-time employment.
